qas.question: What happens when a wrestler has a fall against them?

answers.text: is forced out of the match

qas.question: What kind of rules does a poly-sided match usually have?
What usually happens when two or more wrestlers are involved?

answers.text: to simply go one fall, with the one scoring the fall, regardless of who they scored it against, being the winner.

qas.question: How can a champion lose a championship?

answers.text: does not have to be pinned or involved in the decision to lose the championship.

context: In matches with multiple competitors, an elimination system may be used. Any wrestler who has a fall scored against them <a0_0>is forced out of the match<a0_0/>, and the match continues until only one remains. However, it is much more common when more than two wrestlers are involved <a2_0>to simply go one fall, with the one scoring the fall, regardless of who they scored it against, being the winner.<a2_0/> In championship matches, this means that, unlike one-on-one matches (where the champion can simply disqualify themselves or get themselves counted out to retain the title via the "champion's advantag"), the champion <a3_0>does not have to be pinned or involved in the decision to lose the championship.<a3_0/> However, heel champions often find advantages, not in champion's advantage, but in the use of weapons and outside interference, as these poly-sided matches tend to involve <a1_0>no holds barred rules<a1_0/>.
